title: Marketing partnerships: Stock prices don't always run with the bulls
content:
When two companies form a marketing alliance, investors always herald that as good news and send the companies’ stock prices sky high, right? Well, maybe not. As a new study in the Journal of Marketing shows, marketing alliances can reduce equity risk, but only as long as the alliance is a new one and if the two companies’ existing network of partners is not too interconnected. …read more  

Source:: http://phys.org/news/2015-09-partnerships-stock-prices-dont-bulls.html
